get.description: You can use this endpoints to fetch all the accounts tied to a business. Accounts are sorted by date, with the most recently-created account appearing first.

parameters.description: The parent accountId of the business.
parameters.name: accountId

parameters.description: This endpoint is paginated. `limit` describes the size of the page you are querying
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The `cursor` is used to scroll to the next page. When making the first call to list all accounts, there is no need to pass in any cursor since the API has not returned any cursor back to you. Only use cursor when the API provides it
parameters.name: cursor

results.description: Contains all accounts tied to a specific merchant/business

items.description: A structure representing a Nomba account.

accountHolderId.description: The businessId of the parent that houses this account.

accountRef.description: Unique reference used to track an account from an external process. Would be auto-generated if not provided at the point of creation.

phoneNumber.description: The phoneNumber that is unique to the account bearer.

bvn.description: Bank verification number of the account bearer.

banks.description: Contains all the bank details tied to a Nomba account

items.description: A structure representing a bank account

bankAccountNumber.description: The bank account number tied to the Nomba account.

currency.description: Primary currency on the account (Only supported at the moment is “NGN”).

createdAt.description: The date and time this entity was created. This value uses Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and ISO 8601 format – `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

updatedAt.description: The date and time this entity was updated. This value uses Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and ISO 8601 format – `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

cursor.description: Value used to scroll to next page. It will be empty if there is no more page to scroll to

get.summary: Fetch a single transaction on the parent account

success.description: True if the transaction is already completed and successful, false otherwise

message.description: Response message describing the transaction status

orderId.description: Id generated by Nomba for the checkout order

orderReference.description: Reference of the online checkout order to be created

accountId.description: The account Id whose wallet will be credited when the order is paid

callbackUrl.description: Merchant callback url for redirect after payment

hasSavedCards.description: true if the user has saved cards

base64EncodedRsaPublicKey.description: Base64 encoded RSA public key, returned if data encryption is enabled to submit the card details, else an empty string

DeviceInformation.description: Contains browser information for the device making the api calls

httpBrowserJavaEnabled.description: true if Java is enabled in the browser in use

httpBrowserJavaScriptEnabled.description: true if Javascript is enabled in the browser in use

SecureAuthenticationData.description: Authentication data returned from the payment gateway when the payment card requires 3D Secure authentication. This data will be passed to the

md.description: encryption key is data encrption is in use, else empty string

acsUrl.description: the order reference returned when the order was created

termUrl.description: the order reference returned when the order was created

key.description: encryption key is data encrption is in use, else empty string

orderReference.description: the order reference returned when the order was created

saveCard.description: if true, this this user cardn will be saved for the user's future use. Note the process is not complete until the user-card verification endpoints are called to authenticate the user's phone number.

status.description: true if the card details were submitted successfully

message.description: Response message describing the transaction status or further instruction for the user like the case of OTP

responseCode.description: response code from the payment gate way. 00 means transaction was successful and completed, T0 means an OTP has been sent to the user and should be entered next, SO means  3D Secure authentication is required and the client application needs to redirect to the 3D secure page based on the information provided in the  secureAuthenticationData field

transactionId.description: the unique id of the transaction just created by the submittion of the card details. This value should be passed back to all API calls that require it.

otp.description: otp send to the customer's mobile phone

transactionId.description: transaction id returend when the card details were submitted

status.description: true is the transaction was successful

success.description: true is the transaction was successful

status.description: true is the transaction was successful

accountNumber.description: true is the transaction was successful

otp.description: otp send to the customer's mobile phone

transactionId.description: the transaction Id returned when the card details were submitted

forceCancel.description: Force the cancelation of the transaction

orderId.description: Id generated by Nomba for the checkout order

orderReference.description: Reference of the online checkout order to be created

accountId.description: The account Id whose wallet will be credited when the order is paid

callbackUrl.description: Merchant callback url for redirect after payment

paymentReference.description: The payment reference for the transaction

paymentVendorReference.description: The payment reference returned by the payment gateway

tokenizedCardPayment.description: True if the payment was made by a tokenized card

statusCode.description: transaction status code returned by the payment gateway

beneficiaryAccountName.description: The account name associated with the Merchants Amucha account

beneficiaryAccountNumber.description: The Flash account number, where the payment was made to

originatorAccountName.description: The name of the person making the transfer

originatorAccountNumber.description: Nuban account number of the person making the transfer

narration.description: The naration added by the customer when making the transfer

paymentReference.description: Transfer payment reference passed in from NIBSS for the transfer

currentEmailAddress.description: customer email currently associated with the key

newEmailAddress.description: new email to replace the old one

message.description: customer email currently associated with the key

orderReference.description: The reference of the order created
reference of the online checkout order to be created

callbackUrl.description: Merchant callback url for redirect after payment

tokenizeCard.description: Determines if the card used for payment is to be tokenized

TokenizedCardPaymentRequest.description: The Tokenized card payment request object

tokenKey.description: the token key returned in the webhook

message.description: some details of the transaction response.

tokenKey.description: the key associated with the tokenzied card

cardType.description: Unique reference used to track an account from an external process. Would be auto-generated if not provided at the point of creation.

BankAccountTransferRequest.description: A structure representing an object required to post a bank account transfer.

bankCode.description: The code of the recipient bank.

merchantTxRef.description: Unique reference used to track a transaction from an external process.

BankAccountLookupRequest.description: A structure representing a bank account lookup request

accountNumber.description: The account number to be looked up.

bankCode.description: The bankCode of the bank the account number belongs to. This can be obtained from a call to `/v1/transfers/bank`

BankAccountLookupResult.description: A structure representing a bank account lookup result

accountNumber.description: The account number already looked up.

results.description: Contains result of all banks fetched

expired.description: Whether the virtual account is expired or not

resourceAcquired.description: Whether the virtual account is in use or not

IssueTokenRequest.description: A structure representing an authentication request.

grant_type.description: The grant type of the authentication.

client_id.description: The client's id as obtained from your Nomba dashboard.

client_secret.description: The client's secret as obtained from your Nomba dashboard. It is securely generated by the Nomba system

IssueTokenResponse.description: A structure representing an authentication result.

businessId.description: The accountId of the merchant/business that is connecting to the Nomba system via API

access_token.description: A JWT (Json Web Token) token used to grant access to resources on the Nomba API.

refresh_token.description: A Base64 Encoded String used to refresh an expired access_token

expiresAt.description: The date and time this entity was created. This value uses Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and ISO 8601 format – `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

RefreshTokenRequest.description: A structure representing a refresh token request.

grant_type.description: The grant type of the authentication.

refresh_token.description: A Base64 Encoded String used to refresh an expired access_token

RevokeTokenRequest.description: A structure representing a request to revoke a token.

clientId.description: The client's id as obtained from your Nomba dashboard.

access_token.description: The JWT (Json Web Token) token to be revoked

RevokeTokenResponse.description: A structure representing a response from an attempt to revoke a token

code.description: Tells if the access_token has been revoked

description.description: Describes the result of the action performed

cursor.description: Cursor for pagination. It will be empty if there is no more page to scroll to

WalletTransferRequest.description: A structure representing an object required to post a wallet transfer.

merchantTxRef.description: Unique reference used to track a transaction from an external process.

cursor.description: Cursor for pagination. It will be empty if there is no more page to scroll to
Cursor for pagination. It will be empty if there is no more page to scroll to
Cursor for pagination. It will be empty if there is no more page to scroll to

AccountAccessRequest.description: A structure representing an account access request

grantType.description: The action to perform on the access

clientId.description: The client to grant/deny access to the account

role.description: The role to assume within the account

GenericObjectResult.description: A structure representing a bank account lookup result

data.description: The data object attributed to the action that has been performed

BearerAuth.description: Nomba authenticates API calls with [OAuth2 HTTP bearer tokens](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6750). There are two methods of authentication; [Client-Credentials method](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc6749) and [PKCE (Proof Key for Code Exchange)](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc7636) method. In each of the methods, You will get an `ACCESS_TOKEN`. You need to use an `"Authorization"` HTTP header to provide your `ACCESS_TOKEN`. For example: `Authorization: {ACCESS_TOKEN}`.
